 "Stephen Jay Gould, a well-known evolutionist and professor of geology and paleontology at Harvard University, has stated, "The extreme rarity of transitional forms in the fossil record persists as the trade secret of paleontology.  I believe there is a God because of three things at this time. The first is because I know there have been individuals that have lived lives that have appeared to be what mankind at this stage of development would call ‘close to God’ if a God existed. I know atheist would not agree that is the case but I’m referring to what ‘most’ people would believe. And there is something about their lives that draw others to ‘recognize’ this ‘godliness’ in them. And I think if there was a God, this is how he would manifest himself. I also believe we are just now at the stage of developing that ‘skill’ and our understanding will increase with time. I was raised as a Christian and at one time believed the Bible was the word of God, Jesus was the Son of God, and everything about the Christian religion. I say that to let you know I don’t believe out of some simplistic ‘blind faith’ but have come to my beliefs based on many hours of searching and research into religion and science.
 
 My second reason to believe, although not as strong as my first, is that often you hear of someone who sacrifices their life for a stranger. I understand there are some psychological explanations for this type of behavior but I don’t agree with them.
 
 The third is that because we don’t know what caused the big bang and since I believe my first reason to believe is evidence of a God, I have a compelling reason to believe that event was caused by a God.
 
 Now if you are going to point out a belief in God just moves the first cause back one step, I will agree with you. But it won’t change my belief as I’ve already worked through that part. If there were some explanation besides a God that I thought was valid for my first reason to believe, then I would have to reconsider.
 
 Now that brings us to a belief in souls. I agree there is no evidence that I know of that indicates the existence of souls. But not only is there no evidence of the existence of fairies at the bottom of the garden or pink unicorns, there is no reason to believe in their existence. But because I believe there is a God, then I believe there is a part of God in each of us. And I call that part a soul.
Hank

Energy is "immaterial". Stick your finger in a live socket and find out. 

 
 I was under the understanding that Einstein proved that energy was just another form of matter.
 
 
In that caes you are acting like one and thus are trying to shift the burden of proof.

 
 No I was requesting proof of your statement, not shifting any burden of proof. Deeph had already stated he had no proof. You stated that you had the facts.
 
 
In all of this time no one has ever found the so-called soul, and it wasn't from a lack of trying either. Along the way were have learned much of the body and mind instead, but still no soul. 

 
 Well no one has ever found the explanation for biogenesis either although it’s not from a lack of trying. Does that mean it never happened? There are lots of things that man finds every century. How does not finding something prove there is not that something? Besides how do you find something that is supernatural with natural means?
 
 
Say that you had your mind recorded and one day you are killed and they grow you are new body, and then download your mind into it. Would you still have a soul? If they made other copies would they to have your soul?

 
 I never said the soul was tied to the mind. Different people have different beliefs about a soul or lack of. I happen to believe that it is a part of God in us. I don’t know how it ‘works’ and is therefore a mystery to me. But I still believe it.
Hank

Or in god(s) as well. There is as much evidence for this as with any of those.

 
 I'm sure you will see my other post on this.
Charchuk

If there are souls and or a God, then they are supernatural. How do you use a physical concept on the supernatural?

 
 You don't since that hasn't been proven to exist either.
 
 
I believe there is a God because of three things at this time. The first is because I know there have been individuals that have lived lives that have appeared to be what mankind at this stage of development would call 'close to God' if a God existed. I know atheist would not agree that is the case but I'm referring to what 'most' people would believe.

 
 Arguement from Belief is not a valid arguement.
 
 
And there is something about their lives that draw others to 'recognize' this 'godliness' in them.

 
 Or elese they were jsut good people to begin with. Does one need to believe in god to be a good person?
 
 
 
And I think if there was a God, this is how he would manifest himself. I also believe we are just now at the stage of developing that 'skill' and our understanding will increase with time. I was raised as a Christian and at one time believed the Bible was the word of God, Jesus was the Son of God, and everything about the Christian religion. I say that to let you know I don't believe out of some simplistic 'blind faith' but have come to my beliefs based on many hours of searching and research into religion and science.

 
 The more we learn from science the less we need of religion. The Church at one time had tried to use science to prove the existence of god and when it was found out that it couldn't be used for that then that is when many Christians developed a distrust of science itself..
 
 
My second reason to believe, although not as strong as my first, is that often you hear of someone who sacrifices their life for a stranger. I understand there are some psychological explanations for this type of behavior but I don't agree with them.

 
 Why not. It could be that one's empathy or love is so strong that they think of others before themselves. Does one need god to do this?
 
 
The third is that because we don't know what caused the big bang and since I believe my first reason to believe is evidence of a God, I have a compelling reason to believe that event was caused by a God.

 
 That is tautologic.
 
 
Now if you are going to point out a belief in God just moves the first cause back one step, I will agree with you. But it won't change my belief as I've already worked through that part. If there were some explanation besides a God that I thought was valid for my first reason to believe, then I would have to reconsider.

 
 Why does it need to be a god?
 
 
Now that brings us to a belief in souls. I agree there is no evidence that I know of that indicates the existence of souls. But not only is there no evidence of the existence of fairies at the bottom of the garden or pink unicorns, there is no reason to believe in their existence. But because I believe there is a God, then I believe there is a part of God in each of us. And I call that part a soul.

 
 People for many centuries believed in fairies and the like until their religions were destroyed by Christianity. Many pagan religions held these things as real as you do in your god. They had just as much "reason" to believe in them as you do in yours and just as much evidence as well.
Charchuk

I was under the understanding that Einstein proved that energy was just another form of matter.

 
 Didn't say that it wasn't. Engergy and matter are basically the same thing. All have an energy signature of somekind and can be measured.
 
 
No I was requesting proof of your statement, not shifting any burden of proof. Deeph had already stated he had no proof. You stated that you had the facts.

 
 You're the one who is making an extra-ordinary claim. The existence of a soul.
 
 
Well no one has ever found the explanation for biogenesis either although it's not from a lack of trying. Does that mean it never happened?

 
 How is unknown, but it is easy enough to see the results. Where do I look to see a soul?
 
 
There are lots of things that man finds every century. How does not finding something prove there is not that something? Besides how do you find something that is supernatural with natural means?

 
 They've been looking for centuries, even thousands of years and nothing.
 
 Prove that the supernatural exists in the first place. All that exists is part of nature. You think that nature is only to do with the wild.
 
 Nature:
 
 2. A causal agent creating and controlling things in the universe
 
 If you believe in the supernatural than you must also believe in everything said to be supernatural since by your definition you can't disprove, or prove it. So ghosts, werewolves, vampires, and other supernatural things that go bump in the night must exist as well.
 
 
I never said the soul was tied to the mind. Different people have different beliefs about a soul or lack of. I happen to believe that it is a part of God in us. I don't know how it 'works' and is therefore a mystery to me. But I still believe it.

 
 If it is a part of god in us than how can we sin if we're a part of god?
Charchuk

I'm sure you will see my other post on this.

 
 Of course, but my statement still stands.
Hank

You don't since that hasn't been proven to exist either. 

 
 Well I was replying to wja who said we should use Occam’s Razor. You need to reply to him.
 
 
Arguement from Belief is not a valid arguement. 

 
 I wasn’t arguing from belief. I was arguing that people ‘recognize’ this ‘godliness’ and that is evidence of a God in my opinion. 
 
 
Or elese they were jsut good people to begin with. Does one need to believe in god to be a good person? 

 
 Nope, as I said, I was talking about what people recognize in those men, not that they were good.
 
 
The more we learn from science the less we need of religion. The Church at one time had tried to use science to prove the existence of god and when it was found out that it couldn't be used for that then that is when many Christians developed a distrust of science itself.. 

 
 Why is this pertinent to my statements? 
 
 
Why not. It could be that one's empathy or love is so strong that they think of others before themselves. Does one need god to do this? 

 
 Didn’t I say that I understand there were some psychological explanations but that I didn’t agree with them. You just stated one of the psychological arguments that I don’t agree with.
 
 
That is tautologic. 

 
 Fine then what caused it?
 
 
Why does it need to be a god? 

 
 I never said there needed to be a God, I said I believed there was a God. I guess you don’t believe in a God. My belief is just as good as yours.
 
 
People for many centuries believed in fairies and the like until their religions were destroyed by Christianity. Many pagan religions held these things as real as you do in your god. They had just as much "reason" to believe in them as you do in yours and just as much evidence as well. 

 
 I said there was no evidence. I have a reason for believing there is a God whether you agree with it or not. And for that reason, I believe there is a soul. You may not like it but you don’t have any evidence that I’m wrong either.
Hank

Didn't say that it wasn't. Engergy and matter are basically the same thing. All have an energy signature of somekind and can be measured. 

 
 You said “Energy is "immaterial". “. Sure looked to me that you said energy is not matter.
 
 
You're the one who is making an extra-ordinary claim. The existence of a soul. 

 
 I did not make that claim. I only claimed that I believed that. And that claim is true because I do believe that. However you made this claim 
 
 “You're belief is incorrect. You only base that on belief, I base it on facts. 
 
 You claimed in black and white that deeph’s belief was incorrect and that you based that on facts. I’m still waiting for those facts that you claimed makes deeph’s beliefs incorrect.
 
 
How is unknown, but it is easy enough to see the results. Where do I look to see a soul? 

 
 You can't see the supernatural with natural means. It's a belief.
 
 
They've been looking for centuries, even thousands of years and nothing.
 
 Prove that the supernatural exists in the first place. All that exists is part of nature. You think that nature is only to do with the wild.
 
 Nature:
 
 2. A causal agent creating and controlling things in the universe
 

 
 I can’t prove that the supernatural exist any more than you can prove that it doesn’t exist. And you can’t prove that ‘all that exists is part of nature’. 
 
 What does ‘you think that nature is only to do with the wild’ mean?
 
 
 
If you believe in the supernatural than you must also believe in everything said to be supernatural since by your definition you can't disprove, or prove it. So ghosts, werewolves, vampires, and other supernatural things that go bump in the night must exist as well. 

 
 You don’t determine what I must believe, I determine what I believe. 
 
 
If it is a part of god in us than how can we sin if we're a part of god?

 
 If you want to debate how we can sin, you’ll have to talk to a theist that believes we sin.
